corpus.text: Impressionism was a 19th-century art movement originating in France, characterized by small, thin brush strokes, open composition, and an emphasis on capturing light and its changing qualities. Artists like Monet and Renoir sought to depict sensory impressions rather than detailed realism.
corpus.probe_question: What defines the Impressionist movement in art?

corpus.text: Impressionism focused on light, color, and momentary perception rather than precise realism.
Art of light and fleeting perception.
